info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 8 at 8:23PM CDT until September 10 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Smoky Hill River At Lindsborg affecting McPherson County.
Smoky Hill River near New Cambria affecting Saline County.
Smoky Hill River Near Mentor affecting Saline and McPherson Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Smoky Hill River at Lindsborg.
* WHEN...From late tonight to Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Highway 4, 1 mile west of the gage site begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 27.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 830 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
